explanation: The report is correct. In the project mhd_assert is defined as a no-op (#define mhd_assert(ignore) ((void)0)), so each mhd_assert( ... ); statement becomes an expression statement that performs no action and has no effect on program behaviour. Per MISRA C 2023 Rule 2.2, “Any operation that is executed but whose removal would not affect program behaviour constitutes dead code.” The asserted expression is not evaluated and the statement can be removed without changing behaviour, therefore it is dead code. The provided exhaustive test logs show the code paths execute with the assertion macro compiled out (the probe entries demonstrate the assertion did not affect control flow or state), supporting the conclusion that the mhd_assert occurrences (including the cited assertion) are dead code under Rule 2.2.
